base_note.note_text:
EBUS PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-07-05
Patient: Michelle Brown | MRN: 3427249 | Age: 34F
Attending: Dr. Steven Williams, MD
Location: Duke University Hospital, Durham, NC

INDICATION: 34F with bilateral hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy, erythema nodosum, uveitis. Clinical suspicion for sarcoidosis.

PROCEDURE: EBUS-TBNA of mediastinal lymph nodes

ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation

TECHNIQUE: EBUS (Olympus BF-UC190F) introduced. Systematic staging performed.

Station 7: 25mm, sampled x 4 passes - ROSE: Non-caseating granulomas! Diagnostic.
Station 4R: 15mm, sampled x 3 passes - ROSE: Granulomas
Station 11L: 12mm, sampled x 2 passes - ROSE: Reactive lymphocytes
Station 11R: 10mm, sampled x 2 passes - ROSE: Lymphocytes with granulomas

All specimens sent for cell block, AFB stain, fungal stain to rule out infection.

FINDINGS: ROSE positive for non-caseating granulomas at multiple stations - consistent with sarcoidosis. No necrosis identified.

COMPLICATIONS: None
DISPOSITION: Outpatient discharge. Follow-up in sarcoidosis clinic.

IMPRESSION: EBUS findings consistent with pulmonary sarcoidosis. Await final pathology and infectious stains.

Dr. Steven Williams, MD

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations for sarcoidosis diagnosis. ROSE positive for granulomas.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 31653; total_work_rvu=4.96, total_rvu=7.7 (facility).

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Roger Smith
Medical Record Number: 1824495
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-02-12

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with suspected sarcoidosis. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Linear Ebus:
Endobronchial ultrasound-guided transbronchial needle aspiration was performed utilizing real-time sonographic guidance for precise lymph node targeting. Systematic sampling was conducted at stations 7, 4R, 11L, 11R. Rapid on-site cytological evaluation was employed to ensure specimen adequacy. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
ROSE positive for non-caseating granulomas at multiple stations - consistent with sarcoidosis. No necrosis identified.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31653

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

code_rationales.31653: EBUS-TBNA 3+ stations for sarcoidosis diagnosis. ROSE positive for granulomas.

Patient: Pamela Wood

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Suspected sarcoidosis

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
Moderate

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Linear Ebus performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
sent for cell block, AFB stain, fungal stain to rule out infection.

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31653

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-05-12, Kimberly Bailey, a None-year-old patient (MRN 7113581), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Suspected sarcoidosis. The patient received Moderate and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included endobronchial ultrasound-guided sampling of lymph node stations 7, 4R, 11L, 11R with rapid on-site evaluation. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is granulomatous disease - sarcoidosis. 

Procedural coding: 31653.

COMPLICATIONS: None

Dr. Steven Williams, MD
